sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a regular polygon.
message_1: A regular polygon has 10 sides, each side measures 8 cm. What is the perimeter of the polygon?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a regular polygon, we simply multiply the length of one side by the number of sides. In this case, the polygon has 10 sides, each measuring 8 cm.

Perimeter = (Number of sides) × (Length of one side)
Perimeter = 10 × 8 cm
Perimeter = 80 cm

The perimeter of the polygon is 80 cm.
